trans-unit.source: Additional information
Errors found in your configuration
No errors were found
Warnings about your configuration
IMPORTANT:
WARNING:
The backend is configured to use SaltedPasswords with RSA authentication.

The "rsaauth" extension is installed, but TYPO3 is not configured to use it during login. Use the Install Tool to set the Login Security Level for the backend to "rsa" ($TYPO3_CONF_VARS['BE']['loginSecurityLevel'])
The backend is configured to use SaltedPasswords over SSL.
SaltedPasswords is configured wrong and will not work as expected: It is not possible to set "updatePasswd" and "forceSalted" at the same time. Please disable either one of them.
The selected method for hashing your salted passwords is not available on this system! Please check your configuration.
SaltedPasswords will not work until these problems have been resolved:
SaltedPasswords has been configured to enforce salted passwords (forceSalted). This means that only passwords in the format of this extension will succeed for login.
Frontend requirements for SaltedPasswords are not met, therefore the authentication will not work even if it was explicitly enabled for frontend usage:
Install the "rsaauth" extension and use the Install Tool to set the Login Security Level for the frontend to "rsa" ($TYPO3_CONF_VARS['FE']['loginSecurityLevel'])
Make sure that the Login Security Level is not set to "" or "challenged"!
Alternatively, use the Install Tool to set the Login Security Level for the frontend to "normal" ($TYPO3_CONF_VARS['FE']['loginSecurityLevel'])

SaltedPasswords has been configured to be the only authentication service for the backend. This means that other services like "ipauth", "openid", etc. will be ignored (except "rsauth", which is implicitely used).
SaltedPasswords has been configured to be the only authentication service for frontend logins. This means that other services like "ipauth", "openid", etc. will be ignored.
SaltedPasswords has been disabled for frontend users.
SaltedPasswords has been configured correctly and works as expected.
The frontend is configured to use SaltedPasswords with RSA authentication.
Using the extension "rsaauth" is not possible, as no encryption backend is available. Please install and configure the PHP extension "openssl". See
Install the "rsaauth" extension and use the Install Tool to set the Login Security Level for the backend to "rsa" ($TYPO3_CONF_VARS['BE']['loginSecurityLevel'])
It is also possible to use "lockSSL" and "rsa" Login Security Level at the same time.
SaltedPasswords is used without any transfer encryption, this means your passwords are sent in plain text. Please install rsaauth to secure your passwords submits.

If you have the option to use SSL, you can also configure your backend for SSL usage: Use the Install Tool to set the Security-Level for the backend to "normal" ($TYPO3_CONF_VARS['BE']['loginSecurityLevel']) and the SSL-locking option to a value greater than "0" (see description - $TYPO3_CONF_VARS['BE']['lockSSL'])
Note, that a wrong configuration might have impact on the security of your TYPO3 installation and the usability of the backend.

SaltedPasswords has been configured to be the only authentication service for the backend. Additionally, usage of salted passwords is enforced (forceSalted). The result is that there is no chance to login with users not having a salted password hash.
This has the effect that passwords that were set before SaltedPasswords was used will not work (in fact, they need to be redefined).
This may lock you out of the backend!
Because of this, it is not possible to login with users not having a salted password hash (e.g. existing frontend users).

The "rsaauth" extension is not installed, but TYPO3 CMS is configured to use it. Either install the extension or adapt the configuration by setting [FE][loginSecurityLevel] to "normal" in the Install Tool.

The "rsaauth" extension is not installed, but TYPO3 CMS is configured to use it. Either install the extension or adapt the configuration by setting [FE][loginSecurityLevel] to "normal" in the Install Tool.

The "rsaauth" extension is not installed, but TYPO3 CMS is configured to use it. Either install the extension or adapt the configuration by setting [FE][loginSecurityLevel] to "normal" in the Install Tool.
SaltedPasswords might behave different than expected:
Update all frontend and backend user passwords to salted hashes. This task deactivates itself when completed.
trans-unit.target: Mettre à jour tous les mots de passes utilisateurs (frontend et backend) en MD5. Cette tâche se désactive elle même lorsqu'elle est terminée.

trans-unit.source: The number of records to process on each run must be greater than zero and numeric.
trans-unit.target: Le nombre d'enregistrements à traiter à chaque exécution doit être un nombre supérieur à zéro.

trans-unit.source: Deactivate=
Number of records=
Deactivate if all records are converted
trans-unit.target: Désactiver si tous les enregistrements sont convertis

trans-unit.source: The number of records to process on each run
trans-unit.target: Nombre d'enregistrements à traiter à chaque exécution

trans-unit.source: Convert user passwords to salted hashes
trans-unit.target: Convertir les mots de passes utilisateur en MD5

trans-unit.source: Blowfish salted hashing (advanced)
MD5 salted hashing (secure)
Portable PHP password hashing (phpass)
trans-unit.target: Cryptage de mot de passe portable PHP (phpass)

trans-unit.source: Blowfish salted hashing (advanced)
MD5 salted hashing (secure)
Portable PHP password hashing (phpass)
trans-unit.target: Cryptage de mot de passe portable PHP (phpass)
